author: Amrith Ramkumar
title: Copper Climbs as Trade Worries Abate
text:
Copper prices surged Tuesday after Chinese President Xi Jinpingpromised foreign companies greater access to China’s financial and manufacturing sectors, pledging Beijing’s commitment to further economic liberalization amid rising trade tensions with the U.S.
Front-month copper for April delivery added 1.9% to $3.1310 a pound on the Comex division of the New York Mercantile Exchange—its highest close since March 14. Prices of the industrial metal have fallen 4.5% this year but rebounded of late with gains in eight of the last...
